summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence from 2019 between federal prosecutors and their supervisor requesting and approving travel for victim interviews related to the Jeffrey Epstein investigation (United States v. Epstein, 2018R01618). The travel requests are for trips to Florida (West Palm Beach, Fort Lauderdale) and Los Angeles to interview victims who have come forward.

persons.name: Edward Tyrrell
persons.role: Supervisor/Approving Official (likely a U.S. Attorney's Office supervisor)
persons.context: He is the recipient and approver of multiple travel approval requests from prosecutors investigating the Epstein case. He sends approval emails from his iPad.

persons.name: Michele Duncan
persons.context: She is copied on the travel approval request emails, indicating she is part of the prosecution team working on the Epstein investigation.

connections.description: They are both part of the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, with Tyrrell acting as a supervisor approving travel requests from Duncan and other prosecutors.

events.title: Travel to Fort Lauderdale for victim interview
events.description: Prosecutors request approval to travel to Fort Lauderdale to interview a victim who recently came forward, planning a same-day round trip.

events.title: Travel to Los Angeles for victim interview
events.description: Prosecutors request permission to travel to Los Angeles for a victim interview in connection with the Epstein investigation, planning to fly down on a Wednesday and return by Friday.

events.title: Travel to West Palm Beach for meetings and interviews
events.description: Prosecutors request permission to travel to West Palm Beach, Florida, for approximately three days for meetings and interviews with victims, planning to fly down on a Tuesday night and return Wednesday or Thursday.

events.title: Travel to West Palm Beach for meetings and interviews
events.description: Prosecutors request permission to travel to West Palm Beach, Florida, for approximately three days for meetings and interviews related to United States v. Epstein, an investigation into enticement of minors for sexual activity.

events.title: Travel to Florida for meetings and interviews
events.description: Prosecutors request permission for travel to West Palm Beach and/or Fort Lauderdale, Florida, for two days of meetings and interviews related to United States v. Epstein.

keyFacts: The document references the federal criminal case 'United States v. Epstein, 2018R01618', described as 'an investigation relating to enticement of minors for sexual activity'.
Multiple travel requests in 2019 show active victim interviews were being conducted by SDNY prosecutors in Florida (West Palm Beach, Fort Lauderdale) and Los Angeles.
The emails indicate a pattern of prosecutors requesting permission to reserve hotel conference rooms for conducting victim interviews.
The correspondence shows the internal administrative process (travel approvals) within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York as they pursued the Epstein investigation.
Several prosecutor names are redacted in the emails (shown as blank spaces or single letters like 'M'), indicating ongoing investigative work with multiple team members.
